A **large kobold**, k, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is slightly larger than a normal [kobold](/wiki/Kobold "Kobold") with a slightly stronger weapon attack, and possesses [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") like most [kobolds](/wiki/Kobold_\(monster_class\) "Kobold (monster class)").

A large kobold [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") is [poisonous](/wiki/Poison "Poison") to eat.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Origin](#Origin)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)

- [6 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly-generated large kobolds are always hostile. A kobold can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a large kobold, and a large kobold can grow up into a [kobold lord](/wiki/Kobold_lord "Kobold lord").

Large kobolds may appear among the hostile kobolds that generate in [throne rooms](/wiki/Throne_room "Throne room"), as well as the various monsters that can be randomly generated by [looting](/wiki/Looting "Looting") a throne while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") and carrying gold (provided there is no [chest](/wiki/Chest "Chest") on the level).

A large kobold has a 1⁄4 chance of [generating with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a stack of [darts](/wiki/Dart "Dart").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Strategy

Large kobolds are only slightly stronger than regular kobolds, but otherwise pose much of the same dangers to starting characters: those combat-ready roles are easily positioned to steamroll through them, while the weakest roles may need the assistance of their [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet"). As with regular kobolds, poisoned and/or enchanted darts, a random weapon or even an attack [wand](/wiki/Wand "Wand") can easily turn the tide against any character.

## History

The large kobold first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Kobold (Dungeons & Dragons)](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kobold_\(Dungeons_%26_Dragons\) "wikipedia:Kobold (Dungeons & Dragons)")***

Kobolds are creatures that appear in many fantasy-themed works and media, which often borrow significantly from Germanic folklore - Germanic kobolds are a form of sprite that are generally benevolent if treated with kindness, but will respond to disrespect with anything ranging from pranks to even outright attacking and killing offenders.

*[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")* in particular - and by extension, *NetHack* and many of its variants - depicts the kobold as a race of small reptilian humanoids with long tails, distantly related to dragons; earlier editions gave kobolds more dog-like features, which lead to many depictions of kobolds in Japanese media leaning harder in that direction after the popularity of the anime franchise *Record of Lodoss War*. Fantasy kobolds are often considered weak "cannon fodder" monsters that can be cunning and strong in groups, similar to goblins.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), three large kobolds appear alongside [Kroo the Kobold King](/wiki/Kroo_the_Kobold_King "Kroo the Kobold King") in each variant of the [kobold level](/wiki/Kobold_level "Kobold level") at level creation.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), large kobolds and other kobolds have a mutual [grudge](/wiki/Grudge "Grudge") with [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), large kobolds may appear in the court of a [throne room](/wiki/Throne_room#dNetHack "Throne room") ruled by a [kobold lord](/wiki/Kobold_lord "Kobold lord").

## Encyclopedia entry

The race of kobolds are reputed to be an artificial creation  
of a master wizard (demi-god?). They are about 3' tall with  
a vaguely dog-like face. They bear a violent dislike of the  
Elven race, and will go out of their way to cause trouble  
for Elves at any time.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 456](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L456)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Large kobold

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
k large kobold
Difficulty 2
Attacks Weapon 1d6
k large kobold
Difficulty 2
Attacks

Weapon 1d6

Base level 1
Base experience 13
Speed 6
Base AC 10
Base MR 0
Alignment -3 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 450
Nutritional value 150
Size Small
Resistances Poison
Resistances conveyed None

A large kobold:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • has infravision.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line576

A large kobold, k, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. It is slightly larger than a normal kobold with a slightly stronger weapon attack, and possesses poison resistance like most kobolds.

A large kobold corpse is poisonous to eat.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Origin
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 SLASH'EM
    • 5.2 UnNetHack
    • 5.3 dNetHack
  • 6 Encyclopedia entry
  • 7 References

Generation

Randomly-generated large kobolds are always hostile. A kobold can grow up into a large kobold, and a large kobold can grow up into a kobold lord.

Large kobolds may appear among the hostile kobolds that generate in throne rooms, as well as the various monsters that can be randomly generated by looting a throne while confused and carrying gold (provided there is no chest on the level).

A large kobold has a 1⁄4 chance of generating with a stack of darts.[1]

Strategy

Large kobolds are only slightly stronger than regular kobolds, but otherwise pose much of the same dangers to starting characters: those combat-ready roles are easily positioned to steamroll through them, while the weakest roles may need the assistance of their pet. As with regular kobolds, poisoned and/or enchanted darts, a random weapon or even an attack wand can easily turn the tide against any character.

History

The large kobold first appears in NetHack 3.0.0.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Kobold (Dungeons & Dragons)

Kobolds are creatures that appear in many fantasy-themed works and media, which often borrow significantly from Germanic folklore - Germanic kobolds are a form of sprite that are generally benevolent if treated with kindness, but will respond to disrespect with anything ranging from pranks to even outright attacking and killing offenders.

Dungeons & Dragons in particular - and by extension, NetHack and many of its variants - depicts the kobold as a race of small reptilian humanoids with long tails, distantly related to dragons; earlier editions gave kobolds more dog-like features, which lead to many depictions of kobolds in Japanese media leaning harder in that direction after the popularity of the anime franchise Record of Lodoss War. Fantasy kobolds are often considered weak "cannon fodder" monsters that can be cunning and strong in groups, similar to goblins.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, three large kobolds appear alongside Kroo the Kobold King in each variant of the kobold level at level creation.

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, large kobolds and other kobolds have a mutual grudge with elves.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, large kobolds may appear in the court of a throne room ruled by a kobold lord.

Encyclopedia entry

The race of kobolds are reputed to be an artificial creation
of a master wizard (demi-god?). They are about 3' tall with
a vaguely dog-like face. They bear a violent dislike of the
Elven race, and will go out of their way to cause trouble
for Elves at any time.


References

  1. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 456

A '''large kobold''', {{monsym|large kobold}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is slightly larger than a normal [[kobold]] with a slightly stronger weapon attack, and possesses [[poison resistance]] like most [[Kobold (monster class)|kobolds]].

A large kobold [[corpse]] is [[poison]]ous to eat.

==Generation==
Randomly-generated large kobolds are always hostile. A kobold can [[grow up]] into a large kobold, and a large kobold can grow up into a [[kobold lord]].

Large kobolds may appear among the hostile kobolds that generate in [[throne room]]s, as well as the various monsters that can be randomly generated by [[looting]] a throne while [[confused]] and carrying gold (provided there is no [[chest]] on the level).

A large kobold has a {{frac|4}} chance of [[Monster starting inventory|generating with]] a stack of [[dart]]s.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|456|nethack=3.6.7}}

==Strategy==
Large kobolds are only slightly stronger than regular kobolds, but otherwise pose much of the same dangers to starting characters: those combat-ready roles are easily positioned to steamroll through them, while the weakest roles may need the assistance of their [[pet]]. As with regular kobolds, poisoned and/or enchanted darts, a random weapon or even an attack [[wand]] can easily turn the tide against any character.

==History==
The large kobold first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

==Origin==
{{Wikipedia|Kobold (Dungeons & Dragons)}}
Kobolds are creatures that appear in many fantasy-themed works and media, which often borrow significantly from Germanic folklore - Germanic kobolds are a form of sprite that are generally benevolent if treated with kindness, but will respond to disrespect with anything ranging from pranks to even outright attacking and killing offenders.

''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]'' in particular - and by extension, ''NetHack'' and many of its variants - depicts the kobold as a race of small reptilian humanoids with long tails, distantly related to dragons; earlier editions gave kobolds more dog-like features, which lead to many depictions of kobolds in Japanese media leaning harder in that direction after the popularity of the anime franchise ''Record of Lodoss War''. Fantasy kobolds are often considered weak "cannon fodder" monsters that can be cunning and strong in groups, similar to goblins.

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], three large kobolds appear alongside [[Kroo the Kobold King]] in each variant of the [[kobold level]] at level creation.

===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]], large kobolds and other kobolds have a mutual [[grudge]] with [[Elf (monster attribute)|elves]].

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], large kobolds may appear in the court of a [[Throne room#dNetHack|throne room]] ruled by a [[kobold lord]].

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|<poem>
The race of kobolds are reputed to be an artificial creation
of a master wizard (demi-god?).  They are about 3' tall with
a vaguely dog-like face.  They bear a violent dislike of the
Elven race, and will go out of their way to cause trouble
for Elves at any time.
</poem>}}
